author: EFE
title: Wembanyama dice adiós a la temporada en la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro
text:
Baloncesto
Wembanyama dice adiós a la temporada en la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro
Los San Antonio Spurs informaron de que la trombosis venosa fue detectada tras el regreso del jugador del All-Star del pasado fin de semana
EFE
El pívot y estrella francesa de los San Antonio Spurs Victor Wembanyama se perderá el resto de la temporada de la NBA por un coágulo sanguíneo en el hombro derecho, según informó este jueves la franquicia texana.
Los Spurs indicaron que la trombosis venosa fue detectada tras el regreso de Wembanyama del All-Star, que se disputó el pasado fin de semana en San Francisco (California).
De acuerdo con ESPN, los Spurs creen que se trata de un "problema aislado" para Wembanyama, que fue elegido como número 1 del 'draft' de 2023, 'rookie' del año de la NBA en 2024 y que había sido llamado por primera vez para el All-Star.
El pívot francés promediaba esta temporada 24,3 puntos, 11 rebotes, 3,7 asistencias y 3,8 tapones por partido.
Con estos números, Wembanyama era el favorito para hacerse con el premio de defensor del año al final de la temporada regular.
Los Spurs, con la baja de Wembanyama, prácticamente se despiden de sus opciones de 'play-off', pues actualmente suman 23 victorias y 29 derrotas y son duodécimos en el Oeste.

author: www.rfj.ch, RFJ, Radio Fréquence Jura
title: La banquise mondiale atteint un nouveau plus bas historique
text:
L'étendue cumulée de la banquise autour des deux pôles a atteint un nouveau minimum historique en février, a annoncé jeudi le réseau européen Copernicus. Le phénomène est particulièrement marqué dans l'Arctique.
'Février 2025 s'inscrit dans la lignée des températures records ou quasi records observées au cours des deux dernières années' sous l'effet du réchauffement climatique, souligne dans un communiqué Samantha Burgess, du centre européen pour les prévisions météorologiques à moyen terme (ECMWF).
'L'une des conséquences d'un monde plus chaud est la fonte de la glace de mer' conduisant 'l'étendue mondiale de la banquise à un minimum historique', ajoute-t-elle.
/ATS

author: Jack Davis
title: Boeing Workers Begin Massive Strike, Production of 737 Max Halted
text: Boeing workers in Washington state and Oregon went on strike Friday, bringing construction of Boeing’s 737 Max planes to a halt. Boeing’s stock prices -- already battered by a chain of events that began when the door to a Boeing jet blew off in midair -- dropped 2.3 percent on Friday, according to Reuters. The strike is the company's first since 2008. Pay was a top issue in the talks. Boeing offered workers a 25 percent pay hike over four years; workers wanted 40 percent. BREAKING: @Boeing machinists vote to STRIKE, effective immediately. This means 32,000 @IAM751 and W24 members are on the picket lines starting TONIGHT. Vote to strike was 96% for it pic.twitter.com\/gBUKmkRYOn — Ryan Simms (@RyanTVnews) September 13, 2024 About 30,000 members of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers are now staffing picket lines after 96 percent of those voting on the contract voted for the strike. "This is about fighting for our future," said Jon Holden, lead negotiator for the union. Holden said the union was ready to go back to the table. Boeing offered a similar sentiment. "The message was clear that the tentative agreement we reached with IAM leadership was not acceptable to the members. We remain committed to resetting our relationship with our employees and the union," the company said. New Boeing CEO Kelly Ortberg had urged workers to accept the contract on the grounds that a strike could further damage the company, according to CNBC. Reuters reported that if workers strike for very long, the company would add to its roughly $60 billion in debt. According to The New York Times, citing an estimate from Cai von Rumohr, a research analyst at TD Cowen, if this strike lasts as long as 2008’s 50-day walkout, it would cost Boeing at least $3 billion. Even before the strike, production of the 737 Max was behind schedule at the Renton, Washington, factory where they are made. The slowdown is linked to quality improvements the company has needed to make after the January incident where a 737 Max lost a panel in midair. Fitch warns extended Boeing $BA strike could lead to credit rating downgrade, posing operational and financial risks to the planemaker. — AS Research (@alertscreener) September 13, 2024 On Friday, Boeing CFO Brian West said the strike will “jeopardize” Boeing's recovery if it lasts very long, according to CNBC. West did not discuss whether the strike could impact plans to produce 38 planes per month by the end of the year.

organizations.name: international association of machinists and aerospace workers

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: The Aemet warns about the weather in Spain during the All Saints’ long weekend: this is the date of the end of the DANA
text:
The last hours in Spain have left a desolate panorama. Since this past Tuesday, a DANA (isolated depression at high levels) has left multiple material damage on the Peninsula and has claimed almost 150 lives during the floods it has caused. Locations of Valencian Community, Andalusia, Catalonia and Castilla-La Mancha have experienced the worst side of this storm, which continues to affect our country now, as the State Meteorological Agency has warned ( Aemet ).
After this emergency situation, the focus is now on the evolution of this DANA and how long the devastating consequences it has caused during its time in our country will last. Now, coinciding with the All Saints Bridge which begins this November 1, the storm is heading towards Portugal, although the rains will not disappear of our country and there is still danger.
Update | Special warning for intense rains in the Peninsula and the Balearic Islands.
This Tuesday is the most adverse day of the episode, but the very heavy showers will continue during the following days.
More details
https://t.co/8PQPlLSl74 pic.twitter.com/BTdRF45lzh
— AEMET (@AEMET_Esp) October 29, 2024
According to Aemet, during the next few hours we will continue to be immersed in a episode of heavy rain which will leave rainfall in many parts of the east of the country. But until when will this DANA definitely last according to Aemet? This is what will happen over the weather during the November long weekend.
How long will DANA last in Spain?
According to eltiempo.es, this Friday, November 1, coinciding with the All Saints’ holiday in Spain DANA will be located to the west of the peninsula, over Portugal. Throughout this day, the easterly winds will continue, which will “providing humidity in the Mediterranean” maintaining rainfall in the same areas affected by the storm in the last few hours.
We will have heavy rains throughout the holiday in the northeast and southwest of the peninsula, which could even reach Balearic Islands throughout the day, dumping quite intense showers there. As Aemet has confirmed, in many areas of Spain “the adverse situation will continue during the weekend”: “ The meteorological emergency has not ended . “DANA continues over Spain,” they have warned from the meteorological service, which will maintain the orange level warnings in these regions this Friday due to accumulations that could exceed the 50mm in 1 hour .
DANA will lose intensity during the first hours of the weekend and will weaken as it moves south. Despite this, the rains will continue to persist in many parts of the country and Aemet calls for caution in the face of its possible consequences. «On Thursday and Friday there will be storms again in the southern Catalonia locally intense and rainy again abundant in Extremadura and Western Andalusia », explained Rubén del Campo.
Despite this, the organization points out that these Precipitation will have “nothing to do with with what we have seen in the Mediterranean area. Records are expected that, in some cases, could exceed the 15 or 20 liters per square meter in one hour: « The rains are abundant, but not torrential. », they have warned from Aemet, which expects locally intense rains during the weekend in parts of the Mediterranean and southern Andalusia.
Temperatures for the All Saints Bridge
During this November long weekend, there will still be some « remains of instability in areas of the Mediterranean between the Balearic Islands, Catalonia and the north of the Valencian Community,” explained meteorologist Mario Picazo. « Don’t have a sense of false security in areas of the coast where it does not rain,” Aemet has warned, explaining that the orography can amplify the rainfall in these next few hours.
Although the organization has asked to maintain “caution” and be attentive to changes in the weather forecast, everything indicates that stability will gain ground to the rains as the All Saints’ Bridge weekend progresses.
Throughout the weekend, we will also have generally mild temperatures for the season. During these days, the values it will be around 20 degrees in many capitals, while in the Balearic Islands and Canary Islands they could approach the 25 degrees maximum . For its part, on the northern plateau and the west of the peninsula some slightly cooler thermometers could be recorded, although everything indicates that the minimum temperatures will remain. above 10 degrees .
#Aemet #warns #weather #Spain #Saints #long #weekend #date #DANA

author: franceinfo
title: REPORTAGE. "Cet endroit, c'est le campement de résistance pour la Palestine" : la mobilisation propalestinienne s'étend aux universités britanniques
text: Des étudiants britanniques rejoignent désormais le mouvement de soutien aux Palestiniens, parti des États-Unis à la mi-avril. Sur le campus de Manchester, au milieu des bâtiments de l’université, des dizaines de tentes rouges, bleues et vertes sont plantées sur une pelouse, au milieu de drapeaux palestiniens et d'étudiants harangués par l’une des organisatrices. "Le campus que nous connaissions tous a changé. Les étudiants l’ont repris et disent 'le sionisme et tout ce qui est en lien avec ses crimes : hors de l’université !'", lance la jeune femme à la foule. à lire aussi EN IMAGES. Mobilisations propalestiniennes aux Etats-Unis : après l'évacuation de l'université de Columbia, les affrontements et interpellations sur les campus continuent "Une résistance forte"Sue, étudiante en sciences politiques et militante dans un parti de gauche radicale, fait partie de ceux qui sont à l’origine du campement. Elle dort sur ce qui s’appelle normalement Brunswick Park. "Nous nous sommes approprié cet endroit et nous l'avons renommé, c’est le campement de résistance pour la Palestine", explique-t-elle, devant une cinquantaine de tentes. "Il y a un formidable réseau de solidarité à travers le pays, de plus en plus de campements apparaissent", se réjouit l'étudiante, qui évoque "d'incroyables connexions" et "une résistance forte".Ici, les occupants formulent des exigences claires auprès de la direction de la faculté. Couper les liens avec deux universités israéliennes jugées trop proches de l’armée, ne plus collaborer avec BAE Systems, un fabricant d’armes britannique qui fournit des pièces aux soldats de l’État hébreu et enfin ne pas s’en prendre aux étudiants qui participent à ce mouvement. Des tentes ont été installées sur la pelouse de l'université de Manchester en signe de protestation. (RICHARD PLACE \/ RADIO FRANCE) Liza en fait partie. Ce n'est pas son vrai nom, elle préfère ne pas le donner de peur des représailles. Aujourd’hui, elle devrait plancher sur ses examens d’histoire de l’art. "Mon diplôme n’est pas aussi important que la cause. Je peux encore l’avoir parce que je vais bien, j’ai un abri, des parents et je peux aller à mes cours, plaide-t-elle. Les Palestiniens n’ont pas tout ça.""Si j’étais là-bas, je n’aurais pas pu passer mes examens librement."Liza, une étudiante de Manchesterà franceinfoLa vie s’organise sur ce campement, avec notamment l'organisation d'une soirée folk, de cours de premiers soins, et bien sûr, des manifestations. Ceux qui y dorment affirment qu’ils sont prêts à rester tant que l’université n’aura pas répondu favorablement à leurs demandes.

author: Sean English, WSBT 22 Reporter
title: Security measures prevent Christmas Eve burglary at New Paris church - WSBT-TV
text:
NEW PARIS, Ind. (WSBT) — An attempted break in at a New Paris Church on Christmas eve was unsuccessful.
The Church of the Nazarene had two different failed break-in locations – one in a storage shed and another in the church.
A church official says planning helped repel the thieves.
Around 5 a.m. on Christmas Eve morning, a motion detecting alarm was triggered from a broken window in the church. Before it was broken, this Christmas Grinch had attempted to get in the church's shed.
"They started out with the shed, broke to it first, and they were unable to get anything out of it, because everything was cabled and chained up. And then evidently, they came over to the church window,” said Bob Rossi, Church of the Nazarene Head Trustee.
The shed had a thick cable connecting all equipment inside. So, if someone were to break past the locked door, they would not leave with the equipment inside.
In a Kevin McCallister-like-move from the Christmas classic Home Alone, a previous break in inspired defensive measures made to protect the property from any type of burglary.
"They did break the padlock and got in the building, but they were able to get away with her mower and stuff and after that that's when I decided well, I'm going to cable everything so if they do get in the building they would not be able to get anything out of it,” said Rossi.
Rossi says this defensive move worked like a charm.
“Unless they had something to cut a pretty heavy cable,” said Rossi.
SE: And that defense worked?
“That worked they were not able to get the stuff out of the building,” said Rossi.
Rossi says he's grateful the church's Christmas morning services were able to go on as planned that next day and that nothing was taken.
"We are just grateful they never got them, and never got away with anything,” said Rossi.
The church will continue to stay open every Sunday even if the window is temporarily boarded up.
If you have any additional information on this failed break in, please contact the Elkhart County Sheriff’s Office.

author: Евгений Сергеевич Загоскин
title: SUSU Invites You to Take Part in Immortal Regiment Campaign
text: For 12 years in a row, the Immortal Regiment campaign has been held annually not only in Russia, but around the world as well. This year it takes place May 1st through May 12th. In 2024, the event will again be held in an online format in Russia. The organizers have experience in holding events online. This format was used during the pandemic. There are several ways to honour veterans. For example, print out photos and stick them on your car or clothes. There is a design tool on the Immortal Regiment [website](https://www.polkrf.ru/shtender), where you can choose a frame for a photo, sign the person’s full name and dates of life. Global flash mobs are also planned on social networks. There you can not only post photos, but also share stories about the lives and feats of your relatives with the hashtag #нашБессмертныйПолк (#ourImmortalRegiment). Photos of heroes of the Great Patriotic War will be broadcast on the [Immortal Regiment](https://www.moypolk.ru/) website. In addition, portraits can be seen on media facades in Russian cities and on federal channels. And from May 1st, members of the Volunteers of Victory movement will launch a chatbot on Telegram to create memorable avatars for social networks. The main point of the regiment's march is to preserve personal, family memory of the generation of the Great Patriotic War. Anyone can join the campaign. To do this, you only need a photograph of the hero who brought the Great Victory closer.

author: Jason Owens, Yahoo Sports
title: Pirates rookie Paul Skenes gets best of Jackson Holliday with 100 mph fastball in battle of No. 1 picks – KIRO 7 News Seattle
text: For his next opponent, Skenes faced 2019 No. 1 pick and Orioles All-Star catcher Adley Rutschman. In the end, it was Paul Skenes' time to shine. The Pittsburgh Pirates rookie and No. 1 pick in the 2023 draft hit 102 mph on the radar gun and got the best of a pair of fellow former No. 1 picks in his MLB spring training debut. He did so en route to a 1-2-3 inning as his only action of the day. [Join or create a Yahoo Fantasy Baseball league for the 2024 MLB season ] The main event led off the bottom of the first inning. There, Skenes faced off with Orioles leadoff hitter and 2022 No. 1 overall pick shortstop Jackson Holliday. Skenes induced a groundout with a 100 mph fastball. For his next opponent, Skenes faced 2019 No. 1 pick and Orioles All-Star catcher Adley Rutschman. Rutschman took a 101 mph ball, then barreled a 99 mph Skenes fastball to the warning track. But Edward Olivares was there waiting to record out No. 2. Paul Skenes hit 102 mph twice (on the scoreboard gun) in a scoreless first inning. Here's another battle of No. 1 overall picks, with Adley Rutschman taking 101 mph for a ball & then driving 99 mph to the warning track in RF.— Jim Callis (@jimcallisMLB) [pic.twitter.com/WEMV8SgQpb] [February 29, 2024] Skenes then induced Kjerstad a fly-out from right fielder Heston Kjerstad to end his debut and secure a 1-2-3 inning. Per MLB.com's Jim Callis, Skenes twice hit 102 mph on the scoreboard radar gun. He did all this while pitching to catcher Henry Davis, the No. 1 pick in the 2021 MLB draft. Skenes joined the Pirates in the draft from LSU, where he won multiple National Player of the Year and National Pitcher of the Year honors while leading the Tigers to the 2023 College World Series championship. Expectations are high for both Skenes and Holliday as they prepare for their respective MLB debuts, whenever they may come.

author: VideoElephant
title: Millions of U.S. workers will see a pay increase in 2024
text: At the start of the new year, 22 states and 43 cities and counties are increasing the hourly minimum wage, benefiting nearly 10 million people.
